wrapScienceJ.wrapImaJ.core.operation.convolve

Enum ConvolutionNormalizationPolicy

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<ConvolutionNormalizationPolicy>
      • wrapScienceJ.wrapImaJ.core.operation.convolve.ConvolutionNormalizationPolicy
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<ConvolutionNormalizationPolicy>

    public enum ConvolutionNormalizationPolicy
extends java.lang.Enum<ConvolutionNormalizationPolicy>
    Allows to specify how the results of a finite difference, with its skipping steps implying a multiplication of the result by some integer, are to be normalized. It can be either quantitatively correct by dividing by a correct combination of the skipping steps, or for example with contrast maximized between -126 and 125 and shifted by 126 to fit into a Byte value.

    • Enum Constant Summary

      Enum Constants 
      Enum Constant and Description
      Gray16_QuantitativeNormalization
      Divide by the mask mass (e.g. skipping steps) for quantitatively correct values.
      Gray16_Scale_MaximizeContrast
      Convert to GRAY_8 after maximizing the contrast
      Gray8_divide_256
      Convert to GRAY_8 by dividing by 256
      Gray8_No_Normalization
      Convert to GRAY_8 by dividing by 256
      Gray8_QuantitativeNormalization_Clamp
      Divide by the mask mass (e.g. skipping steps) for quantitatively correct values.
      Gray8_Scale_MaximizeContrast
      Convert to GRAY_8 after maximizing the contrast
      No_Normalization
      Dont't re-normalize at all and return 16 bit per voxel values without dividing by skipping steps.

    • Enum Constant Detail

      • No_Normalization

        public static final ConvolutionNormalizationPolicy No_Normalization
        Dont't re-normalize at all and return 16 bit per voxel values without dividing by skipping steps.

      • Gray8_No_Normalization

        public static final ConvolutionNormalizationPolicy Gray8_No_Normalization
        Convert to GRAY_8 by dividing by 256

      • Gray8_divide_256

        public static final ConvolutionNormalizationPolicy Gray8_divide_256

      • Gray16_Scale_MaximizeContrast

        public static final ConvolutionNormalizationPolicy Gray16_Scale_MaximizeContrast
        Convert to GRAY_8 after maximizing the contrast

      • Gray8_Scale_MaximizeContrast

        public static final ConvolutionNormalizationPolicy Gray8_Scale_MaximizeContrast
        Convert to GRAY_8 after maximizing the contrast

      • Gray16_QuantitativeNormalization

        public static final ConvolutionNormalizationPolicy Gray16_QuantitativeNormalization
        Divide by the mask mass (e.g. skipping steps) for quantitatively correct values. No other conversion. Overflow might occur for large differentiation orders or skipping steps.

      • Gray8_QuantitativeNormalization_Clamp

        public static final ConvolutionNormalizationPolicy Gray8_QuantitativeNormalization_Clamp
        Divide by the mask mass (e.g. skipping steps) for quantitatively correct values. Then Convert to Gray_8, clamping values to 0 or 255 if out of bounds
